prompt: You have just finished performing an ECG on a hospital patient who is known to have a Clostridium difficile infection when you are called to perform a stat ECG in the emergency department. Which of the following is your best course of action?

Quickly apply an alcohol-based hand rub while you are on your way to the emergency department.
Remove all PPE and wash your hands thoroughly before proceeding to the emergency department.

prompt: How should you position a pregnant woman for an ECG?

prompt: QRS duration measurement is essential to determine the time it takes for:

prompt: Measuring the PR interval requires the ECG technician to measure from the:
choices: beginning of the Q wave to the J point.
beginning of the Q wave to the beginning to the T wave.

prompt: The T wave represents:
The ST segment represents
choices: the time between atrial depolarization and atrial repolarization.
the time it takes the Purkinje fibers to repolarize.
the time from the beginning of atrial depolarization to the beginning of ventricular depolarization.
the time between ventricular depolarization and the beginning of ventricular repolarization.

prompt: The J point is the
choices: junction of the QRS interval and the ST interval.
highest peak of the R wave.
point at which the bundle of His divides into branches.
attachment point for the papillary muscles.

prompt: The U wave, which follows the T wave in an ECG tracing, represents:
choices: the time required for ventricular depolarization and repolarization.
the end of ventricular depolarization and the beginning of ventricular repolarization.
repolarization of the Purkinje fibers and the bundle of His.
